revision.text:
{{notable|date=September 2010}} The '''Conference on Semantics in Healthcare and Life Sciences''' ('''CSHALS''') is a scientific meeting on the practical applications of [[semantic technology]] to pharmaceutical R&D, healthcare, and life sciences. It has been held annually since 2008, and is the premier meeting in this domain.
In 2012, CSHALS took on the additional topic of the application of [[Big data|Big Data]] to healthcare and life sciences, while maintaining its previous focus on semantic technologies.
== Organization ==
CSHALS is organized by [[ISCB (International Society for Computational Biology)]].
==List of conferences== {{flagicon|USA}} CSHALS 2008 was held in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts|Cambridge]], USA.
{{flagicon|USA}} CSHALS 2009 was held in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts|Cambridge]], USA.
{{flagicon|USA}} CSHALS 2010 was held in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts|Cambridge]], USA. <ref>International Society for Computational Biology, [http://www.iscb.org/component/docman/doc_download/708-iscb-accomplishments-report-2010-jan-dec Accomplishments Report 2010].</ref> <ref>CSHALS 2010 [http://www.iscb.org/cshals2010-program/cshals2010-press Press Articles].</ref>
{{flagicon|USA}} CSHALS 2011 was held in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts|Cambridge]], USA. <ref>International Society for Computational Biology, [http://www.iscb.org/component/docman/doc_download/1087--iscb-2011-accomplishments-jan-dec11-finalpdf- Accomplishments Report 2011].</ref>
{{flagicon|USA}} CSHALS 2012 was held in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts|Cambridge]], USA.
